summary: This document is an email chain from February 13, 2020, between the UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS). It discusses a press inquiry from the Financial Times regarding the FCA's investigation into Barclays CEO Jes Staley's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and the sharing of information between the US DOJ and UK authorities. The parties agree not to comment publicly.

persons.name: Nick Larkman
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence between the FCA and USANYS regarding the press inquiry and investigation into Jes Staley.

persons.name: Kadhim Shubber
persons.context: Author of the press inquiry to the FCA, asking about information the DOJ passed to UK authorities regarding Jes Staley's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Subject of a UK FCA and PRA investigation regarding his statements about his links to Jeffrey Epstein, as disclosed by Barclays.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier whose relationship with Jes Staley is the subject of the regulatory investigation mentioned in the press inquiry.

connections.description: The document references an investigation into Staley's 'links to' and 'relationship with' Epstein.
The FCA (and PRA) are conducting an investigation into Staley's statements about his links to Epstein.
The email chain indicates communication and information sharing between the US DOJ/SDNY and the UK FCA regarding the Staley/Epstein matter.

events.title: Barclays discloses FCA/PRA investigation
events.description: Barclays publicly discloses that the UK's Financial Conduct Authority and Prudential Regulation Authority are investigating CEO Jes Staley's statements about his links to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Financial Times press inquiry
events.description: Financial Times journalist Kadhim Shubber sends an inquiry to the FCA asking about information the US Department of Justice passed to UK authorities regarding Staley's relationship with Epstein.

locations: London, E20 1JN, United Kingdom (FCA registered office)
Stratford, London, E20 1JN, United Kingdom (FCA and PSR registered office)
keyFacts: The UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and Prudential Regulation Authority (PRA) were investigating Barclays CEO Jes Staley regarding his statements about his links to Jeffrey Epstein.
Barclays publicly disclosed this investigation on February 13, 2020.
The US Department of Justice (specifically the SDNY) had passed information to the UK FCA about Staley's relationship with Epstein, prompting a press inquiry from the Financial Times.
Both the FCA and the US Attorney's Office agreed not to comment publicly on the investigation or their communications.
